byline.contributor: Matthew Rosenberg reported from Washington, and Kareem Fahim from Cairo. Reporting was contributed by Shuaib Almosawa from Sana, Steven Erlanger from London, and Julie Hirschfeld Davis and Nicholas Fandos from Washington.
byline.original: By MATTHEW ROSENBERG and KAREEM FAHIM

abstract: United States officials announce Houthi rebels in Yemen have freed two Americans, one British citizen and three Saudis; release of hostages comes as surprise given that US and Britain do not pay ransoms for their citizens; negotiations that led to release were aided by Oman; Americans are identified as Scott Darden and Sam Farran.
lead_paragraph: The White House announced that the two men were freed along with a British citizen and three Saudis, all of whom had been held by Houthi rebels.

headline.main: 2 Americans Among 6 Hostages Freed in Yemen After Months of Captivity

snippet: The White House announced that the two men were freed along with a British citizen and three Saudis, all of whom had been held by Houthi rebels.
